p: Two major EV-A71 genotypes (B5 and C4) are circulating in Asia. The genotype C1, C4, and C5 were reported to be circulating in Vietnam since 2005 and the dominant genotype of EV-A71 shifted from C5 to C4 in 2011 [ 14, 26] and from C4 to B5 in early 2013 [ 14]. In this study we did not detect significant antigenic variations between genotype C4 and B5 using 33 post-infection children sera, which is similar to other studies conducted in Taiwan [ 27, 28]. Since the sample size for measuring cross-reactive neutralizing antibody titers in our study is small, it would be desirable to collect more sera from young children infected with different EV-A71 genotypes to measure cross-reactive neutralizing antibody titers. Moreover, vaccine candidates using different EV-A71 genotypes are evaluated in clinical trials in different countries (B2 in Singapore, B4 in Taiwan, and C4a in China). It is also critical to monitor cross-reactive neutralizing antibody responses using post-immunization sera collected from young children.
